intro: Petunia parodii, commonly known as the Parodii petunia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Petunia parodii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
